ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I rush through activities with my child without being really attentive to him/her.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: In difficult situations with my child I can pause without reacting straight away.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I tend to make judgements about whether I am being a good or a bad parent.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I pay attention to how my emotions affect the way I act towards my child.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I have trouble thinking of the right words to express how I feel about my child.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: It seems I am runing on automatic without really being aware of what I am doing with my child.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: When I have upsetting thoughts about my child, I am able to just notice them and let them go.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I think some of my emotions towards my child are bad and I should not be feeling them.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I stay aware of my feelings towards my child.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: Even when I am feeling terribly upset with my child, I can find a way to put it into words.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I do not pay attention to what I am doing with my child because I am daydreaming, worrying, or distracted.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: When I get upset with my child I am able to keep calm.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: Some of the thoughts I have about my child are negative and I say to myself that I should not be thinking that way.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I am aware of how my moods affect the way I treat my child.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: I am good at finding the words to describe my feelings about my child.
Notes: 0= Never True; 1= Sometimes True; 2= Often True; 3= Always True

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime
